title: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
description: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled. However, they are not functional and do not have any effect. This can be observed when opening a small image, such as an icon, where the scrollbars are present but do not serve any purpose.
OB: When opening the ImageAnalyzer example in Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only), the scrollbars are enabled. However, they are not functional and do not have any effect. This can be observed when opening a small image, such as an icon, where the scrollbars are present but do not serve any purpose.
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled and not respond to user interaction.
SR:
1. Launch Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210(GTK2 only).
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example.
3. Observe that the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around.
4. Open a small image, such as an icon.
5. Notice that the scrollbars are present but do not have any effect when moved.
